reviews.text: Five Friends booked into the Pied Bull to celebrate one of my friends birthdays. We had a wonderful time. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The Premier Suite is 'huge' but all the rooms are a good size and well equipped with all you require for a short break in Chester. The food at the Inn was delicious. (especially the home made chips)Breakfast was substabtial and enjoyed by all of us. There is a lovely chinese restaurant about 2 doors away its small so you may have to book a table but its well worth it. We'll definately be back.
reviews.title: Fabulous short stay in a welcoming inn :)

reviews.text: we had a girly weekend here, sight seeing, shopping , and brill evening out . there was 10 of us all together aged from 30 to 60 (whom the 60 yr olds was in high spirts from all the alcohol they drank keeping up with the young ones ! lol.)
reviews.title: brillant and well worth every penny ! and def will be returning !

reviews.text: we arrived earlier at lunch time and checked in well before 2pm which the staff was really helpful and let us store our luggage until we could enter our rooms . so we had a couple of drinks ,then went out to see the sights and find out the history of chester , and did some shopping and find out the night life places to go. we arranged with the pub staff to have a table ready for 5.30pm for our evening meal . which when we arrived back our bags was already placed in our rooms and the table was all set and ready for us. the meal was beautiful and served excellent , prices were very reasonable and ample amount.
reviews.title: good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after the meal we hit the night seen. we were informed the bar's last orders was usually at 12 but we had a key to enter what ever time we liked , some did return at 12 and was served until 1am in which we bought a few night caps and sat talking till at least 2.30am till the other girls returned back (again these were the 60yr olds .lol) then retired to bed .
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in the morning we went down to breakfast to find our table set for us and ready to serve us with what ever we liked . later in the morning we checked out our rooms and again the stafff stored our luggage as we were not being picked up until 4pm.
reviews.title: Too Rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poor service, substandard accommodation, terrible food, I’ve honestly slept better in a field on exercise with the Army!!!!!!!!.
reviews.title: You'd sleep better if you stayed at the races!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on a stag do (booked by someone else). All we really needed was a place to sleep, but that proved way harder than it should've.
reviews.title: No frills; if you've a choice, stay somewhere else

reviews.text: If you use their car park, be careful when you drive in; there's a paving slab raised in the middle of the ramp and no matter how slow you go over it you scrape the underneath of your car (and mine's not a low car).
reviews.title: Faulty Towers

reviews.text: The pub itself is best described as olde worlde - average beer selection and friendly bar staff. No real complaints about the bar, and the people in our group who ate here said the food was ok.
reviews.title: The quaint and quirky Pied Bull

reviews.text: The real problems start when you go to the rooms. Very very out of date and tired, poorly decorated and not what you'd describe as clean. The bathroom had mould on the ceiling and on the walls, the hot tap dripped/ran constantly (so not able to have cold water to clean your teeth) and shower only suitable if you're under five foot and a bit.
reviews.title: loved it!!
Ok to rest your head for the night
reviews.text: We got a deal on a nights stay in this Inn for fifty pounds. And its not worth any more than that. It was clean and basic - with enough wardrobe space.. Clean towels and a hot shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fan outside never seemed to stop whirring all night!
reviews.title: food and drink

reviews.text: we never got to have breakfast due to a heady night out in Chester, On the plus side its in a great location, and the pub its self is decent enough. So, OK to rest your head after a night out if you can get it cheap enough.
reviews.title: Pied Bull, not too bad

reviews.text: Food was very nice and fresh but portions was very small, ordered bangers and mash with veg ,,two very nice bangers small portion of mash ,half a carrot ,six very thin green beans in onion gravy all of this for £8.95. Beer very nice .left still hungry .. great place for a drink??
reviews.title: Shockingly bad bed. Incredible heat even...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much the same as everyone else is saying. The rooms are large, warm and clean although a few things left a sour taste. Cigarette butts coming out of the bathroom sink, TV didn't work properly, a noisy ventialation fan, tired looking furnishings and bedding, very obvious springs in bed, inadequate parking (a real cheek to charge for it!), a lot of noise from the small lane alongside the pub - hopefully this was a one off but police cars and some annoying sod crying Alan at the top of her lungs at 3am didn't help with a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Four Poster Bed Room Disaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I could give this hotel a minus for service & value it would be -1000.
reviews.title: Awful customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and our friends stayed in this hotel for 1 night after a race meeting at chester races, and have been returning customers for a number of years.
reviews.title: So worth a visit - an excellent stay, great everything - silly not to.

reviews.text: Credit card statement arrived a few weeks after our stay only to see we had been charged an extra night. Transpires that they had charged us a cancellation fee (of one nights stay totalling £120) for not turning up, even though we had already paid for 2 rooms for one nights stay. Tried to query this with the staff they were as helpful as a chocolate teapot. When we finally got hold of the manager after a couple of days only to be told it is my word against his and i would not be able to prove i was right, even though the credit card they had charged was supposedly cancelled. There was no investigation no interest and the customer service I was given was diabolical.
reviews.title: THE BEDS LET THE PUB DOWN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whos to say they dont do this to any old customer when their sales are low and to get their revenue up one month. The age old saying of the customer is always right went out of the window here an i certainly will not be returning.
reviews.title: Great Location - lacking in customer care
